CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 5-13 Careful combinations of donor and acceptor units have yielded low band polymers with a band gap of 1.3 - 1.7 eV , which lead to high PCEs exceeding 7% . 14-17 A variety of good donor moieties , including oligothiophenes , 18-23 carbazole , 24 benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene , 25-27 and dithienosilole , 14,28 have been demonstrated as useful for low band gap polymers ; good acceptor moieties including thieno- [3,4-b]thiophenes substituted with electron - withdrawing groups , 29-31 N-alkylthieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione , 25,28 benzothiadiazole , 24,32 and 2,5-bis(2-alkyl)pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-(2H,5H)-dione 33-36 have been developed. However , good acceptor moieties enabling polymers to absorb wavelengths over 800 nm remain still rare though acceptor moieties strongly affected to produce a narrow band gap. 37-40 In search of new acceptor moieties , we designed an interesting structure of N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]-pentalene-4,6-dione ( DTPD ). The DTPD is a structural combination of thieno [3,4-b]thiophene and N-alkylpyrrole-2,5-dione. The thieno [3,4-b]thiophene is a particularly suitable structure to promote quinoid structures in conjugated polymers. 41-44 However , simple incorporation of the thieno- [3,4-b]thiophene units might increase the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) level of polymers , which causes a significant loss of open - circuit voltages in PSCs. 42 Thus , it is desirable to attach electron - withdrawing groups such as ketone or ester groups and fluorine atoms. 12,15,30 Here we glued the Nalkylpyrrole-2,5-dione , a strong electron - withdrawing unit , 45 to the thieno [3,4-b]thiophene to bring down the HOMO level. Our DFT calculations , indeed , suggested that the DTPD would be a strong electron - withdrawing acceptor moiety ( Figure S1 ). 26,45 Therefore , each fractional unit in the DTPD may exert a synergetic effect to permit strong donor - acceptor electronic delocalization by the quinoid structure and to locate HOMO and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) levels of resulting low band gap polymers in a deep state when the DTPD is copolymerized with an appropriate donor moiety. Despite these promising features , to the best of our knowledge , the DTPD moiety has never been utilized to synthesize low band gap polymers for PSCs. Herein , we report synthesis and characterization of two polymers , POBDTPD and PEBDTPD , that consist of DTPD and BDT moieties substituted with octyloxy or 2-ethylhexyloxy g r o u p s , r e s p e c t i v e l y . P O B D T P D : P C 7^0 B M a n d PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blends utilized light absorption up to 900 nm in the generation of photocurrents and showed optimal morphology and efficient exciton separation , yielding PCEs exceeding 5% . This work demonstrates that the newly designed DTPD moiety is a promising building block for high performance PSCs . The thermal properties of the polymers were examined by differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) and thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ). In the DSC curve , neither polymer displayed a transition up to 300 °C ( Figure S2a,b ).

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. Donor units:
 * Oligothiophenes
 * Carbazole
 * Benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene
 * Dithienosilole
2. Acceptor moieties:
 * Thieno-[3,4-b]thiophenes substituted with electron-withdrawing groups
 * N-alkylthieno[3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione
 * Benzothiadiazole
 * 2,5- Bis(2-alkyl)pyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-(2H,5H)-dione
 * N-Octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]-pentalene-4,6-dione (DTPD)
3. Other materials:
 * PCBM (porphyrin-containing polymer)
 * PC70BM (polystyrene-based polymer)

The "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

* DTPD (N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]-pentalene-4,6-dione)
* POBDTPD (polymer consisting of DTPD and BDT moieties substituted with octyloxy group)
* PEBDTPD (polymer consisting of DTPD and BDT moieties substituted with 2-ethylhexyloxy group)
* PCBM (polymer containing porphyrin units)
* PC70BM (polymer consisting of polystyrene units)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph:

1. DTPD (N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]-pentalene-4,6-dione)
2. POBDTPD (polymer consisting of DTPD and BDT moieties substituted with octyloxy group)
3. PEBDTPD (polymer consisting of DTPD and BDT moieties substituted with 2-ethylhexyloxy group)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid entities referring to "Material Name" in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DTPD |
| POBDTPD |
| PEBDTPD |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Paragraph: 5-13 Careful combinations of donor and acceptor units have yielded low band polymers with a band gap of 1.3 - 1.7 eV , which lead to high PCEs exceeding 7% . 14-17 A variety of good donor moieties , including oligothiophenes , 18-23 carbazole , 24 benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene , 25-27 and dithienosilole , 14,28 have been demonstrated as useful for low band gap polymers ; good acceptor moieties including thieno- [3,4-b]thiophenes substituted with electron - withdrawing groups , 29-31 N-alkylthieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione , 25,28 benzothiadiazole , 24,32 and 2,5-bis(2-alkyl)pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-(2H,5H)-dione 33-36 have been developed. However , good acceptor moieties enabling polymers to absorb wavelengths over 800 nm remain still rare though acceptor moieties strongly affected to produce a narrow band gap. 37-40 In search of new acceptor moieties , we designed an interesting structure of N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]-pentalene-4,6-dione ( DTPD ). Despite these promising features , to the best of our knowledge , the DTPD moiety has never been utilized to synthesize low band gap polymers for PSCs. Herein , we report synthesis and characterization of two polymers , POBDTPD and PEBDTPD , that consist of DTPD and BDT moieties substituted with octyloxy or 2-ethylhexyloxy g r o u p s , r e s p e c t i v e l y . This work demonstrates that the newly designed DTPD moiety is a promising building block for high performance PSCs . The thermal properties of the polymers were examined by differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) and thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ). In the DSC curve , neither polymer displayed a transition up to 300 °C ( Figure S2a,b ).

 * 14, 28

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 5-13 Careful combinations of donor and acceptor units have yielded low band polymers with a band gap of 1.3 - 1.7 eV , which lead to high PCEs exceeding 7% . 14-17 A variety of good donor moieties , including oligothiophenes , 18-23 carbazole , 24 benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene , 25-27 and dithienosilole , 14,28 have been demonstrated as useful for low band gap polymers ; good acceptor moieties including thieno- [3,4-b]thiophenes substituted with electron - withdrawing groups , 29-31 N-alkylthieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione , 25,28 benzothiadiazole , 24,32 and 2,5-bis(2-alkyl)pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-(2H,5H)-dione 33-36 have been developed. However , good acceptor moieties enabling polymers to absorb wavelengths over 800 nm remain still rare though acceptor moieties strongly affected to produce a narrow band gap. 37-40 In search of new acceptor moieties , we designed an interesting structure of N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]-pentalene-4,6-dione ( DTPD ). The DTPD is a structural combination of thieno [3,4-b]thiophene and N-alkylpyrrole-2,5-dione. The thieno [3,4-b]thiophene is a particularly suitable structure to promote quinoid structures in conjugated polymers. 41-44 However , simple incorporation of the thieno- [3,4-b]thiophene units might increase the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) level of polymers , which causes a significant loss of open - circuit voltages in PSCs. 42 Thus , it is desirable to attach electron - withdrawing groups such as ketone or ester groups and fluorine atoms. 12,15,30 Here we glued the Nalkylpyrrole-2,5-dione , a strong electron - withdrawing unit , 45 to the thieno [3,4-b]thiophene to bring down the HOMO level. Our DFT calculations , indeed , suggested that the DTPD would be a strong electron - withdrawing acceptor moiety ( Figure S1 ). 26,45 Therefore , each fractional unit in the DTPD may exert a synergetic effect to permit strong donor - acceptor electronic delocalization by the quinoid structure and to locate HOMO and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) levels of resulting low band gap polymers in a deep state when the DTPD is copolymerized with an appropriate donor moiety. Despite these promising features , to the best of our knowledge , the DTPD moiety has never been utilized to synthesize low band gap polymers for PSCs. Herein , we report synthesis and characterization of two polymers , POBDTPD and PEBDTPD , that consist of DTPD and BDT moieties substituted with octyloxy or 2-ethylhexyloxy g r o u p s , r e s p e c t i v e l y . P O B D T P D : P C 7^0 B M a n d PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blends utilized light absorption up to 900 nm in the generation of photocurrents and showed optimal morphology and efficient exciton separation , yielding PCEs exceeding 5% . This work demonstrates that the newly designed DTPD moiety is a promising building block for high performance PSCs . The thermal properties of the polymers were examined by differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) and thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ). In the DSC curve , neither polymer displayed a transition up to 300 °C ( Figure S2a,b ).

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the values of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Band gap:
The band gap of the low-band polymers is mentioned to be 1.3 - 1.7 eV.
2. HOMO level:
The highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) level of the polymers is mentioned to increase when simple incorporation of thieno [3,4-b]thiophene units is done. This indicates that the HOMO level is higher in the polymers with thieno [3,4-b]thiophene units.
3. LUMO level:
The lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) level of the resulting low-band gap polymers is mentioned to be located in a deep state when the DTPD moiety is copolymerized with an appropriate donor moiety.
4. PCE:
The power conversion efficiency (PCE) of the polymers is mentioned to exceed 7% and 5% for the POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers, respectively.
5. Donor moieties:
Good donor moieties for low-band gap polymers include oligothiophenes, carbazole, benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene, and dithienosilole.
6. Acceptor moieties:
Good acceptor moieties for low-band gap polymers include thieno[3,4-b]thiophenes substituted with electron-withdrawing groups, N-alkylthieno[3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione, benzothiadiazole, and 2,5-bis(2-alkyl)pyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-(2H,5H)-dione.
7. Incorporation of DTPD moiety:
The DTPD moiety is designed to be a structural combination of thieno [3,4-b]thiophene and N-alkylpyrrole-2,5-dione. The DTPD moiety is attached to the thieno [3,4-b]thiophene unit to bring down the HOMO level.
8. Electron-withdrawing groups:
Electron-withdrawing groups such as ketone or ester groups and fluorine atoms are mentioned to be attached to the thieno [3,4-b]thiophene units to decrease the HOMO level.
9. Thermal properties:
The thermal properties of the polymers were examined by differential scanning calorimetry (DSC) and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA). Neither polymer displayed a transition up to 300 °C.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the relevant entities from the text that refer to the value of material properties:

1. Band gap: 1.3 - 1.7 eV
2. HOMO level: located in a deep state
3. LUMO level: located in a deep state
4. PCE: exceeds 7% and 5% for POBDTPD and PEBDTPD polymers, respectively

These are the only entities in the text that directly refer to the value of material properties. The other entities mentioned in the text (such as donor and acceptor moieties, and the incorporation of DTPD moiety) are not directly related to the value of material properties.
